thread.section_title: Broward County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Palm Beach Gardens LB Vandarius Cowan decommits from Florida State
thread.title_full: Palm Beach Gardens LB Vandarius Cowan decommits from Florida State - Sun Sentinel

author: Patrick Maks
title: Palm Beach Gardens LB Vandarius Cowan decommits from Florida State
text:
Palm Beach Gardens linebacker Vandarius Cowan has decommitted from Florida State, the junior announced Sunday afternoon through Twitter.
Cowan, a four-star recruit regarded as one of the top prospects in Palm Beach county, didn’t offer a reason for his decision, but wrote “it was a very hard decision and took a lot of time.”
In addition to the Seminoles — who were upset by unranked Georgia Tech Saturday — Cowan holds eight offers from the likes of Miami, Georgia, Notre Dame and West Virginia.
Cowan, a 6-foot-3, 221-pound prospect, committed to Florida State in June, having been wooed by the Seminoles and several other schools since his freshman year.
Cowan joins Palm Beach Gardens teammates senior safety Devin Studstill (a three-star recruit who holds almost 20 offers including Notre Dame) and junior defensive back Amari Carter (who holds offers from Auburn, North Carolina and West Virginia) as standouts who have yet to finalize future plans.
According to the recruiting website 247sports.com, Cowan is the seventh-best outside linebacker in the country and 17th-best player in the state of Florida for the class of 2017.
Aquinas kicker commits to Illinois
St. Thomas Aquinas James McCourt has committed to Illinois, the senior announced late Sunday. McCourt joins teammates and fellow Fighting Illini commits in senior receiver Dominic Thieman and junior running back Mike Epstein.
